title: (x) Guys and Dolls movie poster - Kabel, Romeo {Jan E, Yves}
content:
Anyone know the font used on the marquee-like signs here (without the lights of course)?

if you can ID what is used for the actors' names, that'd be helpful too.

thanks

gregg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003106im_/http:/typophile.com/files/guys-and-dolls-sign_5921.jpg)
author: hereandthere

comments.content:
marquee-like signs looks like ITC Kabel Ultra.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-kabel/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003106/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-kabel/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-kabel/")

pretty darn similar, but not exact.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003106im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-1_3510.jpg)
Samuel Goodwyn - Bodega Sans with some vert scaling, perhaps?

\> pretty darn similar, but not exact.

It’s as close as you can get, I’m afraid. Probably customized.
Oops, didn't see one typeface still neede identifying. The Art Deco sans is [Romeo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130205003106/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=romeo).
Oh man, I knew it had to be a Font Bureau font.
Technically it wasn't a Font Bureau font at the time this poster was created.
